caption: Everything about my experience was superb!  Location: I reserved a greenhouse for dinner which was well ventilated and still provided us with privacy. There was also a small space heater available in case it got chilly. It was very cute!!  Service: Spectacular!! Our waiter and the gentleman who prouder our our food were super friendly and knowledgeable. Our waiter in particular made sure we were comfortable and we’re getting our meals fired as we were wrapping up our starters. We found out he also made our drinks were delicious and strong!  Food: Absolutely delicious! We had the steak tartare and grilled octopus to start. I’ve never eaten steak tartare before so I can’t compare it to anything but it was very good! The grilled octopus was my favorite. The char on the octopus was to die for. I would definitely order that again. Our entrees were the Parisian gnocchi and the roasted duck. The gnocchi melted in my mouth and was so fresh. I might even say that’s the best gnocchi I’ve ever had. My partner had the duck and absolutely loved it. I thought it was delicious as well!  Summary: It’s a delicious restaurant with a great staff, definitely go try it out!!!

Went to Lutece for first time last night.  Sat in hut.  Welcoming Atmosphere, rug on floor, flowers, heater.  Started with foccacia Bread which was addictively good.  Crispy on outside, chewy on Inside.  Charred cabbage salad was unique and delicious.  Husband’s Salad was quality lettuce and very good.  Note: portions were Generous on all food.  Entrees were duck and roast chicken.  Both Delicious.  Roast chicken most moist and meaty ever.  Dessert was a Rhubarb whipped cream confection which was refreshing but could have Had more fruit.  Will definitely go back!
Excellent food at a reasonable price for fine dining. Dined outdoors and had great service. I absolutely loved the wine and the gnocchi. Would definitely eat here again!
My girlfriend and I loved it! The staff was welcoming and the atmosphere there is cozy. Very good food, definitely give it a try if you haven't yet.

Not ideal.  While dining outside, the staff had continuous challenges securing the yurt/greenhouse door which made everything very chilly and distracting. Moreover, the kitchen staff completely forgot to prepare one of our 3 entrees which arrived 20 minutes after the other 2 were served.  While a free drink was provided for this glaring oversight, the entire experience left us with a sour taste.
We are there for brunch today.  It was fantastic.  Food was delicious and service was exceptional.  Definitely a revisit - again and again.
Fine quality food, and top level service. Just rug up well.

Thr cheese and walnut bread platter is amazing!! Cuz.. ordered the breakfast burrito...simply yummy. Our waiter " Shane"..big shout out!!! Check out this place, they have warm private kiosks 🥰🥰..small party , date night feel.
Fantastic experience. Food and service were great. Will be back soon.

Update Jan 2021  Same great food. We shared a sweet potato, tender and sweet, with just the right amount of nuts and blue cheese. My our steaks were cooked to order (one medium, one rare) obviously prime beef, very tender, excellent seasonings. Great cocktails, including a delicious non-alcoholic one, as was the waiter’s recommendation on a glass of red to go with the wine. Being a slim fellow without a care as to calories, he tried to convince us to take the chocolate dessert, but we opted instead for the delicious rice pudding with a crunchy granola style top — we’re going with the theory that it was another vegetable. My dessert Sémillon wine was outstanding as well.  Big change is the individual outdoor “chalets” occupying what used to be parking on Wisconsin Avenue. Plenty of room for four, spacious for just the two of us, with translucent wall panes allowing filtered outside street lights and the headlights of passing cars.Very romantic, made even cozier by the electric heater in the corner. Staff were all appropriately masked, and we were happy to don our own each time food or drink was served. All perfect.  Many thanks to DC Council and the Mayor for permitting streeteries and for helping out financially. Let’s hope streeteries continue year round.  Original from Feb 2020  What a pleasant surprise!  This is for us a neighborhood restaurant, just a block from our house. It was previously Cafe Bonaparte, which was not a cafe, but rather a crêperie with a few extra dishes thrown in. The decor and vibe was quite Parisian, which we liked. It was also quite cheap, and attracted big crowds into its tiny space for dinner, which we did not like. I recall meals cheek by jowl, and once the host tried to seat our party of three at a table for two; we walked out, and haven’t been back for dinner since, preferring instead the excellent Bistro Lepiq up Wisconsin or the equally outstanding Chez Billy Sud ( more nouveau French) and La Chaumière (more classic French) down in the more commercial heart of Georgetown.  Now Lutece: remodeled, and delightfully more open after they’ve converted former crowded tables in the rear to stools from which patrons can peer into the kitchen. A great host/waiter offered perfect service, attentive but not intrusive. I do fear that on a crowded night the service, as in the Bonaparte days, might slow to a crawl, but I was pleased when the bartender pitched in to help — teamwork!  Outstanding cocktails — mine was Green Chartreuse bittered with Fernet Branca, sweetened just so with curaçao, plus a gentle squeeze of lime. Check the online menus — we had carrots and dry-age duck, roasted chicken, a burger, and tile fish, all to perfection, a bit of something for every taste. And the desserts! We inquired about the chef, Matt Conroy, and he popped out to say hello.  Many thanks to the Popal Group for this outstanding renovation and reimagining. It works. We’ll be back!
Great brunch food, felt very safe in our own little cabin.

Terrific meal. We sat in one of the outdoor huts and were quite comfortable on a relatively cold evening. Everything we ordered was prepared superbly. Get the fresh ricotta and sweet potato as appetizers. I had the chicken which was presented boneless and was very moist and perfectly cooked. I also ordered delicious French fries as a side.My wife had the gnocchi which was also great. Excellent service completed the wonderful experience.
Everything we ate was overly greased
Ganache... Do yourself a favor
Outstanding French cuisine.

Was surprised that French restaurant is not just a name.. I live in Florida 4 years, most places there called “French restaurant” has the same tasteless food. But here we go, Georgetown!!! Amazing, delicious, absolutely incredible smoked creamy salmon, half rib sandwich, avocado toast and OF COURSE cheese plate! Figs were so savory and flavored, topped with the honey..that cheesy lovers won’t stand it! I didn’t really like their Mimosa, was a little weird, like it was not a champagne, no bubbles, tasted more like martini. But they replaced a flowers on our table for a fresh vase twice) Aaand a chocolate gamash with granola at the end of the lunch is absolutely fantastic!

too bad it was replaced by the amazing crepes. the food was just at average. and furthermore they force us to pay 22% tip. wirhout telling you at the begining. i mean i tottally understand the whole support the local restaurants during covid but by forcing you to pay 22% tip I would never go back there. it is my choice how much i wanna tip not forcing me.
The food is delicious and the wine pairs it perfectly.
This place was terrific! Both the food and cocktails were spectacular.

As a French citizen living in Florida and visiting Georgetown, I wanted to try this French restaurant, I had a good surprise: everything was delicious: the steak tartare very fresh and tasty, the Parisian gnocchi: so light with vegetables and a light sauce, the roast half chicken, so tasteful with the carrots, it was a wonderful experience and we did a very healthy choice, I will definitely go back again, what a good place to have a French dinner!

What a great addition to Georgetown! Full disclosure... we were big fans of chef Matt Conroy when he was doing wonders at Oxomoco in Brooklyn, so we rushed to see what magic he would bring to this new spot. Everything was outstanding... tomato salad, corn soup, chicken, lamb ribs, charred cabbage, burger, grilled swordfish, atmosphere, service. They were very pandemic-friendly with sufficiently-spaced tables both indoors and outdoors. Can't wait to come back.
Wandered in here while walking down Wisconsin. Amazing red wines by the glass, unreal gnocchi and excellent service. Would highly recommend :)

Went last evening to this Georgetown restaurant, reopened with a new chef, Matt,  and a new menu. Had come here many years ago when it was Cafe Bonaparte for breakfasts of great coffee and crepes. Since we have just moved back and heard they were doing dinner we wanted to try. It was excellent! My wife and I started with the steak tartare, and the kohlrabi and blood orange salad. Both were so unique and so flavorful. For entrees we had the gnocchi with mushroom, and the duck. Again the gnocchi was very unique and yet was ‘comfort food’ delicious and the duck was prepared and seasoned perfectly. We finished off with the almond cake whose passion fruit glacé was just the right touch of citrus. Service from Simona was professional, and attentive but very friendly and welcoming. All and all our best dining experience since we returned to Washington DC five months ago, and that includes restaurants we loved, like Chez Billy Sud, 1789, Fiola Mare, etc.
